text: Hey! You there.
Where is Omar Clean?
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: A cowardly answer.
You know more than you're letting on.
I will crush you. Then you will tell me where he is.
Prepare to fight.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: You've fought well. I'm impressed.
I... er... probably should have asked you if you knew anything before I fought you.
Sorry about that.
Now, I know I'm in no position to ask for anything, but...
dialogue.name: Dialogue 1

text: ... you don't actually know anything about Omar, do you.
Sorry about that.
You seem like you're looking for Omar as well.
I might be able to help you, if you do a small favour for me first.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 2

text: Aha, another one of his pathetic middlemen, always solving his problems...
Very well. I will crush you. Then you will tell me where he is.
Prepare to fight.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: You've fought well. I'm impressed.
I... er... probably should have asked you if you knew anything before I fought you.
Sorry about that.
Now, I know I'm in no position to ask for anything, but...
dialogue.name: Dialogue 1

text: ... you don't actually know anything about Omar, do you.
Sorry about that.
You seem like you're looking for Omar as well.
I might be able to help you, if you do a small favour for me first.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 2

text: Excellent.
A bit of background: Omar is a piece of human refuse.
I've often wondered if I'm being too hard on him...
But one grows tired of being left at the bottom of a giant dirt pit with nothing to show for it.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Very well.
If you have a change of heart, come find me once more.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Well, yes, but, I digress.
You don't need to hear the whole torrid affair.
It's a tale as old as time, as they say.
Boy meets girl, boy uses girl to get treasure...
Boy runs off with some idiot poet...
Boy leaves girl with gigantic debt and jail time.
Forgive me. This time I will digress properly.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Maybe you're passing judgement on a situation you know nothing about.
Just a thought.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Dig sites, to be more specific.
We used to be... archaeologists.
Of a sort.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Hello again.
Are you ready to take on that favour I mentioned?
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Now then, about this favour.
I'd like you to bring me any personal effects of Omar's that you find.
Simply put, I want to destroy them.
I'm not normally so petty, but... I'm afraid my pettiness is all I have left.
Goodness. That is... truly one of the most depressing things I've said out loud.
Well then, if that didn't make me seem like an irredeemable mess, I'd love your help.
I have a few passcodes that will unlock certain rooms in this house.
For each item you find, I can give you a passcode.
So, let me know if you find anything of Omar's I can burn.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: When I see that Omar, I am going to give him a piece of my mind.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Oh, you've found something?
Yes, excellent! Excellent! This must be some sort of prized heirloom.
I will destroy it presently. Thank you.
Here, take a passcode. It should unlock one of the rooms around here.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 1

text: Ooh, you've found a pair of his best pants!
Magnificent! I cannot wait to tear these to shreds.
Thank you for finding these.
Here is a passcode for your troubles.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 2

text: Alright, destroying these things has been more satisfying than I want to admit.
Thank you for fueling my literally destructive behaviour.
Have a wonderful rest of your evening.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 3

text: Thank you for your help.
Destroying other people's things is so cathartic.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Good evening. I am Mahmoud, the poet.
I seem to have lost something of mine.
Would you be a dear and help me find it?
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Ah, very good!
I'm looking for a locket I've lost.
Well, lost is perhaps not the right word.
I gave it to a man named Omar Clean a long time ago.
He broke up with me shortly after and made off with the locket.
I was sort of hoping I would be able to find it here.
If you could take a look around for it, I would really appreciate it.
I don't have money, but I can give you some kind of reward.
I'll be here if you find anything.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Drat.
If you change your mind, please, come find me.
Until then, I must bid farewell.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Have you given any more consideration to helping me find my locket?
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: You've been keeping an eye out for my locket, I hope?
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: My goodness! You've found it!
Thank you so much.
I can finally be rid of this man.
I don't have much of a reward to give you, but, here's a book of my poems.
Reading it will be a very enriching experience, I hope.
Have a wonderful evening!
dialogue.name: Dialogue 1

text: Omar was always such a showboat.
Look at this ridiculous house.
Thanks again for finding my locket.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Good evening.
Just so you know, I would have karate-chopped you in the neck for approaching me like this.
But I'm trying to take it easy.
I, uh, ahem, broke my hand on the last guy's throat.
Name's Eloise.
I'm here tracking down a dangerous criminal named Omar Clean.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Are you from the agency? I don't recognize you.
You must be a private investigator, then.
Omar's made a lot of enemies, I'll give him that.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: The man's wanted worldwide for a serious of heists and raids of archaeological sites.
The house we're in right now, it's been funded by these missions.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Well, I could use any information you have on Omar.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: I'm here to arrest Omar.
If you can find them, or any evidence of misdeeds, I'd love to hear about it.
I'm still looking for an incriminating set of flight records, if you can find them.
I'll be here if you have any questions or find any clues.
But, don't tell anyone I'm here. Or I'll take this arm brace off and beat you with it.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Still on the lookout for those flight records?
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Ah, you found them. Excellent.
Listen, I've heard from one of my moles that Omar has been spotted moving about.
You can help me trap him if you like.
Try retracing your steps and see if you can find him.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 1

text: Good work today.
Stay on your toes. We're close to catching Omar.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

text: Might I ask you for a favour?
I can make it worth your while.
dialogue.name: Dialogue 0

assets.name: Locket
assets.description: A beautiful locket, inscribed with: "From M to O -- with love"

assets.name: Nice Pants
assets.description: A beautiful pair of pants. The name tag says "O. Clean".

assets.name: Weird Heirloom
assets.description: Some sort of trinket. An inscription reads: "My treasured grandson".

assets.name: First Passcode
assets.description: Dazmina said this will unlock a certain door in the mansion for you.

assets.name: Book Of Poems
assets.description: Mahmoud gave you his poetry book, "LOVE IS NOT A CHEST OF DRAWERS". It should be an intellectually stimulating read.

assets.name: Flight Records
assets.description: A summary of where Omar Clean has traveled lately.

assets.name: Second Passcode
assets.description: Dazmina said this will unlock a certain door in the mansion for you.
